In a message dated 8/17/01 7:23:56 PM Pacific Daylight Time, 
thecode@... writes:

<< OOC: A mark is someone who likes the most glittery or overrated wrestlers. 
IE you. The Rock, when he first came in, was jammed down everyone's throats. 
RVD has also earned his dues. DDP and Kanyon are 2 of the most talented 
wrestlers today. Kanyon knows moves, major advantage over Matt Hardy. I don't 
care if he doesn't spit in his hand. The majority of the good wrestlers are 
placed in WCW ECW. You like WWF better, because they're good guys, and 
therefore you cheer them on, much like what marks generally do. No shame in 
that, but what I said is completely true and it's not worth arguing the 
truth. PA: Booker T has been wrestling for 15 years now. HE'S paid his 
dues... >>

No...then I am not a 'mark'.  Who the hell comes up with these gay words like 
"bomdigity" and making "tight" into a meaning for "cool"?  When the Rock 
first came into the WWF he wasn't the Rock.  He was Dwayne Johnson.  And he 
was booed.  Then he was Flex Kavana.  And he was booed.  Then he was Rocky 
Maiva, and he was booed.  Then he became the Rock.  Then because of this 
great character he had made, he gained popularity and is as great as he is.  
He has charisma and personality.  He has great moves and talent.  He's not a 
babyface, by the way, he's a heel.  So you're wrong about that.  The only 
time I root for babyfaces is when they're ridiculously outnumbered and 
someone is to much of a wuss to fight them.  Which, gee, the Rock always goes 
in headfirst.  And I like bad guys majorly, hence the whole Decepticon thing 
with me.  In G1 they're trash-talked and always lose, but they're still cool 
because they have attitude unlike the mostly monotonic attitude of the 
Autobots.  "They're in trouble we must aid them."  But the Decepticons, 
"They're in trouble, let's sit back and watch 'em burn!"  Rock isn't really a 
bad guy, but he sure as hell isn't a babyface.

See, if you'd read what I type, you'd notice I talked about the charisma and 
moves.  Costumes aren't that important.  Hell, look at Kane.  What he's 
wearing now is gay.  Before that he had it perfected.  I don't like the whole 
biker thing with Undertaker.  But that's okay, because they make up for it 
with skill and cool attitudes.  The WCW lacks those.

If WCW or ECW were any good, they wouldn't have fallen.  They're just 
breeding grounds for really good wrestlers like Stone Cold and such who join 
the WCW.  Only reason WWF superstars joined WCW is there contracts would end 
with the WWF and ol' Turner would be there waving muchos money in their face. 
 Booker T.'s been wrestling in what for 15 years?  He sure as hell sucks for 
going that long.  

The Rock has NEVER backed down from a fight.  Everyone else has.  Stone Cold, 
Kurt Angle, Shane O'Mac, all of 'em.  That's part of the Rock's character.  
He won't back down, even if he gets the hell beat out of him.  Sometimes he 
wins, sometimes he doesn't.

-L. Unitron
